title: Yuma High School student shot, killed in off-campus accident
content:
A sophomore at Yuma High School died Monday after an off-campus shooting.
According to a police statement, Jaden Rahm, 16, was killed in the incident, which happened south of the school.
Yuma Police said the incident is still under investigation, but initial reports indicated that the shooting was accidental.
“There is still some forensic evidence that needs to be processed and an autopsy needs to be performed, but evidence points to this being a tragic accident,” according to the police statement
Reports indicated four males were inside a vehicle during the lunch hour when a bird hunting shotgun that was inside the vehicle went off and struck Jaden.
The other three occupants in the vehicle are not considered suspects, police said.
According to the statement, the school was not placed on lockdown and there were no threats to either students or the community. Counseling services were made available to the school’s students and staff.
